title: Norwegian billionaire saves Thomas Cook Nordic arm with promise to inject £500m
text:
Billionaire property tycoon and environmental campaigner Petter Stordalen has led the rescue of collapsed travel agent Thomas Cook’s Nordic arm, saving more than 2,000 jobs - and promising to inject almost £500m into the business.

Alongside private equity firms TDR Capital and Altor, Mr Stordalen has agreed to buy the Ving Group, which includes brands such as Globetrotter, Spies and Thomas Cook’s Scandinavian airline.

Although Thomas Cook collapsed into liquidation in Britain late last month - stranding 150,000 British holidaymakers abroad - many of its overseas subsidiaries have continued trading while a buyer is found.

Mr Stordalen’s Strawberry Group said Thomas Cook Northern Europe, which...
description: Billionaire property tycoon and environmental campaigner Petter Stordalen has led the rescue of collapsed travel agent Thomas Cook’s Nordic arm, saving more than 2,000 jobs - and promising to inject almost £500m into the business.
